Bug.WithStack:
These articles need to be updated for Eclipse 3.1: http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-1/tutorial1.html , http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-2/tutorial2.html , http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-3/tutorial3.html Created attachment 24895 RCP Tutorial part 1 draft 1
Reassigning to me; interested parties please add yourself to the cc list.
Here's the first draft of the new tutorial, part 1. It was a bit more of a rewrite than I first thought. I decided to go the full feature-product-native launcher route that is the recommended best practice althought it made the tutorial a little longer. Let me know what you think.
Like part 1, I plan for parts 2 and 3 to be similar to the scope of the current parts but with a much heavier emphasis on using the PDE wizards and editors than before.
Note that I plan to split up this bugzilla entry to just have one bugzilla per part; I just think it will be easier to keep the attachments and comments straight that way and it also lets me publish them on different schedules. Split off part 2 into bug 104170, and part 3 into bug 104171. I recommend to have a small "agenda" at the beginning of the first article (like you may know from presentations). It should describe (very short) what the reader will see in which part of the article series. That way the reader always knows where he stands when he is following the tutorial and doesn't get this feeling of being lost somewhere between blocks of instructions. :) Hi Ed, I just read the revised article and I like it.
I have a few comments from a PDE perspective:
1. it would be better to focus on 3.1 and not dwell on the past, ie. what things were like pre-3.1. Sentences like the ones below are an unnecessary distraction from the nice workflow you are describing.
"This (OSGi bundle format) is different from previous versions where it was recommended not to select this format."
and "Trying out RCP applications used to be somewhat tedious. You had to create a custom launch configuration, enter the right application name, and tweak the plug-ins that were included."
2. "Unfortunately the Hello RCP template does not so we'll have to make one." This was actually done intentionally, specifically for a case like yours (or the upcoming RCP book) when someone is trying to demonstrate the creation of a product from first principles. We have richer templates for those who want them.
3. "You may see an error appear in the Problems view until you Synchronize (see below). This is normal. "
This problem fell through the cracks in 3.1. Please tell people to first set the product name on the overview page and then press New... This way, they won't get the transient error marker and you wouldn't need to mention it. We will fix this for 3.1.1 (i.e. if the product name is not set in the editor, we will add an extra field to the wizard) as this seems to be an unpleasant first impression to some.
4. "Typically this would not occur unless you are converting an older plug-in that did not use MANIFEST.MF into one that does" This is not correct. When you create a manifest.mf file for an existing plug- in, PDE trims down the plugin.xml file to remove all redundant information, and only extensions/extension points are left in the xml file.
5. Very flattered that the troubleshooting section has become obsolete :-)
Nice piece of work overall. Regarding comment #3, the parts are being written sequentially as I get time so I don't have a table of contents for the other two parts yet.
Regarding comment #4, 1) I wanted some backward looking stuff to help someone who read the previous version tell what was different. Maybe I overdid it. 2) It would be better if the templates were more configurable so I could mix and match what went into it, like a checkbox for a feature, a product, a view, branding, etc.. 3) ok, 4) I was referring to a manual conversion, I'll make that clearer.
Thanks for the comments. Created attachment 24965 RCP Tutorial part 1 draft 2
Updated, added source. Part 1 has been published, closing. thanks for the great tutorial (wanted to start with rcp since a while ago ;-) a few things: part 2 says " In part 1, we implemented one of the simpler methods, getInitialWindowPerspectiveId" -- but there's nothing in part 1 mentioning this, seems it belongs to the "Hello"-template? there are several code snipptes but nothing about the files those snipptes fit into, a short info about the file's name would be very nice so a newbee like me knows which files to change ... Parts 2 and 3 are in the process of being rewritten, see bug 104170 and bug 104171. Until that's done they're not going to match up, sorry. Part 2 has been updated now. Based on some feedback I've gotten on this article, I'm thinking of retooling it to get rid of the feature and making the example product plug-in based. The main reason is that it seems that hardly anybody uses just the plugins in the base rcp feature, and this has caused more than one person to stumble despite a note about that in the article. Anybody have any objections to this simplification? Update for 3.1.2 A new version has been published of all three parts. Minor, but confusing:
"Now select the Configuration tab and click Add.... Select the plug-in you just created (org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1) and then click on Add Required Plug-ins."
Should specify that the coder should "Open the launch configuration for the product" (otherwise it's opaque which "Configuration" tab is being discussed.) At that point you're still in the Product Configuration editor, and don't need to open the launch configuration. You select the Overview tab and do something, select the Configuration tab and do something, then select the Overview tab again and do something. So unless I'm missing something (which is possible!) I think it's correct the way it's written. (In reply to comment #15) > At that point you're still in the Product Configuration editor, and don't need > to open the launch configuration. You select the Overview tab and do something, > select the Configuration tab and do something, then select the Overview tab > again and do something. So unless I'm missing something (which is possible!) I > think it's correct the way it's written. > I see the problem, now -- the issue I was addressing is that the new plugin does *also* need to be added in the "Plugins" tab of the launch-config wizard -- a step I often forget, and which I was looking to see mentioned in the article. I've tried running part 1 in latest 3.2 build and found that exporting the project to \deploy folder exports the plugin only, but not the eclipse executable or core libraries- is this the expected behaviour? Andreas, you probably exported the plug-in instead of the product. If you export the product it should give you the executable and everything else. (In reply to comment #12) > Update for 3.1.2
Does this mean the projects in the 'accompanying zip files' will not work with 3.1.1 any more?
When launching after exporting as described I get: ... org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The activator org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1.Part1Plugin for bundle org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1 is invalid ... org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[1]: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1.Application ... (In reply to comment #19) OK after deleting...unzipping...importing...not changing anything...exporting again. If you change anything, like the name of your application or the name of your plug-in or the name of your main class, it's hard to find all the places that need to be changed. I've often had this problem when copying projects. This is better in 3.2 but I don't think it's completely automatic yet. I am following part 1 of the tutorial: http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-1/tutorial1.html
I am using Eclipse 3.2 (from the Callisto release).
Comment about the section "Making it a product": There is something missing in the description here. When I follow the steps in the tutorial and try to launch my application from the product config file, I get an error that indicates that the splash screen cannot be found.
Found some more info about this in the bug database: bug #66421
I found the solution in comment #24 of that bug: "Ricky, your product configuration is missing the required bundles. On the configuration tab of your product definition you must click the "Add Required Plug-ins" button to add the necessary bundles to launch."

Thanks in advance. Mike The "Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui_0.0.0." error is the main clue, I think. Either there's something wrong with your config.ini (probably in the osgi.bundles line), or maybe you're not supplying all the bundles that are required when you deploy the app (or don't have them selected in the plug-ins tab of the launch configuration). (In reply to comment #27) > The "Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui_0.0.0." error is the main clue, I > think. Either there's something wrong with your config.ini (probably in the > osgi.bundles line), or maybe you're not supplying all the bundles that are > required when you deploy the app (or don't have them selected in the plug-ins > tab of the launch configuration). >

Florin, as far as I know you're the only one who has run into this problem. I certainly never saw it in various versions of 3.1, 3.2, or 3.3, though I can't say for sure that I tried it in the exact same versions you tried it in. If it were some kind of generic bug I'd expect to see a lot of people complain about it, but since that's not the case I'd suspect something unique in your setup.
It's easy (I've done it several times myself) to get something messed up in the plug-in dependencies or target environment that could give errors like this, especially when migrating from one version of Eclipse to another. Other common problem sources are problems unpacking the zip, unpacking one version of Eclipse on top of another, and I've even seen a corrupt download or two. (In reply to comment #32) First of all, thanks for answering.
I don't know what to say/think, it's just what happened to me. I used different Eclipse installations (not unpacking on top of each other). I still have them installed (each of them also contains other working projects). Every time I followed the tutorial's steps and only on one version it didn't work. Maybe it's just something strange (since nobody else stumbled at the same point).
Anyway, I'm happy I have at least to versions that are working, so I got the picture of Eclipse's RCP mechanism and went on. Thanks. Hi

Bug.WithOutStack:
These articles need to be updated for Eclipse 3.1: http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-1/tutorial1.html , http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-2/tutorial2.html , http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-3/tutorial3.html Created attachment 24895 RCP Tutorial part 1 draft 1
Reassigning to me; interested parties please add yourself to the cc list.
Here's the first draft of the new tutorial, part 1. It was a bit more of a rewrite than I first thought. I decided to go the full feature-product-native launcher route that is the recommended best practice althought it made the tutorial a little longer. Let me know what you think.
Like part 1, I plan for parts 2 and 3 to be similar to the scope of the current parts but with a much heavier emphasis on using the PDE wizards and editors than before.
Note that I plan to split up this bugzilla entry to just have one bugzilla per part; I just think it will be easier to keep the attachments and comments straight that way and it also lets me publish them on different schedules. Split off part 2 into bug 104170, and part 3 into bug 104171. I recommend to have a small "agenda" at the beginning of the first article (like you may know from presentations). It should describe (very short) what the reader will see in which part of the article series. That way the reader always knows where he stands when he is following the tutorial and doesn't get this feeling of being lost somewhere between blocks of instructions. :) Hi Ed, I just read the revised article and I like it.
I have a few comments from a PDE perspective:
1. it would be better to focus on 3.1 and not dwell on the past, ie. what things were like pre-3.1. Sentences like the ones below are an unnecessary distraction from the nice workflow you are describing.
"This (OSGi bundle format) is different from previous versions where it was recommended not to select this format."
and "Trying out RCP applications used to be somewhat tedious. You had to create a custom launch configuration, enter the right application name, and tweak the plug-ins that were included."
2. "Unfortunately the Hello RCP template does not so we'll have to make one." This was actually done intentionally, specifically for a case like yours (or the upcoming RCP book) when someone is trying to demonstrate the creation of a product from first principles. We have richer templates for those who want them.
3. "You may see an error appear in the Problems view until you Synchronize (see below). This is normal. "
This problem fell through the cracks in 3.1. Please tell people to first set the product name on the overview page and then press New... This way, they won't get the transient error marker and you wouldn't need to mention it. We will fix this for 3.1.1 (i.e. if the product name is not set in the editor, we will add an extra field to the wizard) as this seems to be an unpleasant first impression to some.
4. "Typically this would not occur unless you are converting an older plug-in that did not use MANIFEST.MF into one that does" This is not correct. When you create a manifest.mf file for an existing plug- in, PDE trims down the plugin.xml file to remove all redundant information, and only extensions/extension points are left in the xml file.
5. Very flattered that the troubleshooting section has become obsolete :-)
Nice piece of work overall. Regarding comment #3, the parts are being written sequentially as I get time so I don't have a table of contents for the other two parts yet.
Regarding comment #4, 1) I wanted some backward looking stuff to help someone who read the previous version tell what was different. Maybe I overdid it. 2) It would be better if the templates were more configurable so I could mix and match what went into it, like a checkbox for a feature, a product, a view, branding, etc.. 3) ok, 4) I was referring to a manual conversion, I'll make that clearer.
Thanks for the comments. Created attachment 24965 RCP Tutorial part 1 draft 2
Updated, added source. Part 1 has been published, closing. thanks for the great tutorial (wanted to start with rcp since a while ago ;-) a few things: part 2 says " In part 1, we implemented one of the simpler methods, getInitialWindowPerspectiveId" -- but there's nothing in part 1 mentioning this, seems it belongs to the "Hello"-template? there are several code snipptes but nothing about the files those snipptes fit into, a short info about the file's name would be very nice so a newbee like me knows which files to change ... Parts 2 and 3 are in the process of being rewritten, see bug 104170 and bug 104171. Until that's done they're not going to match up, sorry. Part 2 has been updated now. Based on some feedback I've gotten on this article, I'm thinking of retooling it to get rid of the feature and making the example product plug-in based. The main reason is that it seems that hardly anybody uses just the plugins in the base rcp feature, and this has caused more than one person to stumble despite a note about that in the article. Anybody have any objections to this simplification? Update for 3.1.2 A new version has been published of all three parts. Minor, but confusing:
"Now select the Configuration tab and click Add.... Select the plug-in you just created (org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1) and then click on Add Required Plug-ins."
Should specify that the coder should "Open the launch configuration for the product" (otherwise it's opaque which "Configuration" tab is being discussed.) At that point you're still in the Product Configuration editor, and don't need to open the launch configuration. You select the Overview tab and do something, select the Configuration tab and do something, then select the Overview tab again and do something. So unless I'm missing something (which is possible!) I think it's correct the way it's written. (In reply to comment #15) > At that point you're still in the Product Configuration editor, and don't need > to open the launch configuration. You select the Overview tab and do something, > select the Configuration tab and do something, then select the Overview tab > again and do something. So unless I'm missing something (which is possible!) I > think it's correct the way it's written. > I see the problem, now -- the issue I was addressing is that the new plugin does *also* need to be added in the "Plugins" tab of the launch-config wizard -- a step I often forget, and which I was looking to see mentioned in the article. I've tried running part 1 in latest 3.2 build and found that exporting the project to \deploy folder exports the plugin only, but not the eclipse executable or core libraries- is this the expected behaviour? Andreas, you probably exported the plug-in instead of the product. If you export the product it should give you the executable and everything else. (In reply to comment #12) > Update for 3.1.2
Does this mean the projects in the 'accompanying zip files' will not work with 3.1.1 any more?

Thanks in advance. Mike The "Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui_0.0.0." error is the main clue, I think. Either there's something wrong with your config.ini (probably in the osgi.bundles line), or maybe you're not supplying all the bundles that are required when you deploy the app (or don't have them selected in the plug-ins tab of the launch configuration). (In reply to comment #27) > The "Missing required bundle org.eclipse.ui_0.0.0." error is the main clue, I > think. Either there's something wrong with your config.ini (probably in the > osgi.bundles line), or maybe you're not supplying all the bundles that are > required when you deploy the app (or don't have them selected in the plug-ins > tab of the launch configuration). >

Bug.Summery: Closed bugs can not be re-opened
Bug.WithStack:
We have had "complaints" from community and committers in WTP that closed bugs can not be re-opened.
We have adopted a workflow where verified bugs are (eventually, if not directly) put into a 'closed' state, and if it was mis-verified, or subsequently regresses, the community would like to re-open the original bug, instead of createing a new one that refers to the old one.
And, in fact, the document on eclipse bug reporting at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugzilla.html does state explicitly "And yes, closed bugs can be reopened if need be."
When I originally reported this bug to webmaster, I was told he'd been asked to specifically disallow re-opening closed bugs by some committers who found users were incorrectly re-opening bugs.
I'm not sure what that was about, but would seem to be more correctly solved by user education, than by prohibiting it its correct use.
In either case, either the Eclipse preferred workflow needs to be better documented and the document at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugzilla.html corrected, or we should allow users to re-open closed bugs. I believe this is a debatable issue.
See bug 83068 comment 7 and bug 83068 comment 8
Some projects want to restrict who can change what, and some projects want it wide open.
I believe these features should be requested against bugzilla itself. I can't do much other than determine default behavior, and so far it's been as described in the comments above.
Denis

Denis

Bug.Summery: Custom XML DTD not honored for validation/content assist in JSP
Bug.WithStack:
The Voice Tools Project would like to allow editing of VoiceXML in the JSP editor to complete our markup editing environment. I have tried creating the following snippet in the JSP editor:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding ="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE vxml PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD VOICEXML 2.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml21/vxml.dtd"> <vxml version="2.1">
</vxml>
The editor complains "Unknown tag (vxml)." on the <vxml> tag. In the content assist a few HTML-oriented items are proposed (img,table,ul, etc). I believe I have defined a proper entry in the XML Catalog to go with this DTD. Renaming the snippet to .xml and loading the XML editor causes validation and content assist to work fine. Its great to get bugs opened from voiceXML project, and I am sure we have a ways to go to "get it right" for your content type, so I'm sorry to resolve this as 'wontfix' -- and indeed we *might* be able to improve validation and content assist for cases like this -- BUT, for this specific case, putting in a page directive with the content type identified solves the problem. As below. The JSP Specification is pretty specific that if "contentType" is not specified, then text/html is to be assumed -- which I think is all we are trying to follow. I suppose you'd need something like this contentType=text/xml or ?vxml? to get it "served" properly to client, also, right?
Don't hesitate to re-open if I'm missing the point, and don't hesitate to open new ones for all the special cases you'll have for us to handle.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding ="UTF-8"?> <%@page contentType="text/xml"%> <!DOCTYPE vxml PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD VOICEXML 2.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml21/vxml.dtd"> <vxml version="2.1">
</vxml> I apologize for not being well versed in the JSP specification -- the current method for content type behaviors makes sense now. Closing for WTP1.5 release.

Bug.Summery: "entity reference error" not being highlighted by as-you-type validatoin
Bug.WithStack:
The entity "foo" was referenced, but not declared.
This is one of the cases that should produce a red squiggle but doesn't. Note that we do squiggle these problems when 'foo' occurs within an element's text node.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <tns:Root> <foo value="ewrew&foo;rewew"/> <foo value="affffdsfdsdssdds"/> </tns:Root> Created attachment 24890 patch for org.eclipse.wst.xml.ui plugin
This patch fixes this. I'll take a look a look at patch, see if it still applies.
patch did not apply any longer, but, I could tell the significant code is now in computeStartEndLocation so, "manually" applied there.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Verified this has been fixed. This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee. If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
Thanks, John Lanuti

Bug.Summery: Treat content types ending in +xml like text/xml in JSP editor
Bug.WithStack:
A convention for XML languages is to define a content type that ends in "+xml", ie "application/voicexml+xml". If one of these is identified the default behavior of the JSP editor should be to use text/xml behaviors unless otherwise defined. Created attachment 24891 A simple 6-line example of a .jsp file using a simple +xml content type This seems a small change would get us a long way to supporting more types. (without fancy extensions, etc.).
Phil, would this be a small change in that initializtion code you did?
The code to look at would be:
EmbeddedTypeRegistry#getTypeFor(mimeType)
which returns an embedded type handler. The registry could return EmbeddedXML for anything w/ "+xml". Currently the registry checks if the mimeType is in any of its EmbeddedTypeHandler's list of "supportedMimeTypes", then returns that handler.
Instead we might be able to change it to a more flexible call like "EmbeddedTypeHandler#canHandleMimeType(mimeType)".
Or if we want to better preserve the current behavior, we can default to calling "canHandleMimeType(mimeType)" only if the type isn't found in the supported mime type list. Since the document/partitioner need to be created before the model there's one other change that would have to be made is in:
StructuredTextPartitionerForJSP#createStructuredTextPartitioner(...)
...
else if (contentType.equalsIgnoreCase(XML_MIME_TYPE) || contentType.endsWith("+xml")) { result = new StructuredTextPartitionerForXML(); result.connect(structuredDocument); } ...
Where partitioner for XML is created for contentType ending w/ "+xml". While this was entered as an "enhancement" by client, I think many end-users will experience as a "bug" ... and while these other general types will not be well tested, fixing this at least allows the community to experient with them. Therefore, I am approving for RC2.
changes are in HEAD. Closing

Bug.Summery: EAR import does not hook up EJB module and EJB client module

Lines.Line: 1) Create an EJB project named "TestEJBProject". Accept all the defaults and
associate with an EAR called "TestEJBProjectEAR". By default, a client
project called "TestEJBClientProject" will also be created.
2) If you get an EJBArtifactEdit for "TestEJBProject" and call its
getEJBClientJarModule(), you will get the correct TestEJBClientProject
IVirtualComponent.
3) Export TestEJBProjectEAR as an EAR file to the local filesystem.
4) Delete all TestEJBProject, TestEJBClientProject and TestEJBProjectEAR from
the workspace.
5) Import The EAR exported in step 3.
6) If you call EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule(), you'll now get an
NPE:

Bug.WithStack:
When I import an EAR which has an EJB module with an associated EJB client module, the relationship between the two doesn't appear to be preserved. To reproduce the problem you can do the following:
1) Create an EJB project named "TestEJBProject". Accept all the defaults and associate with an EAR called "TestEJBProjectEAR". By default, a client project called "TestEJBClientProject" will also be created.
2) If you get an EJBArtifactEdit for "TestEJBProject" and call its getEJBClientJarModule(), you will get the correct TestEJBClientProject IVirtualComponent.
3) Export TestEJBProjectEAR as an EAR file to the local filesystem.
4) Delete all TestEJBProject, TestEJBClientProject and TestEJBProjectEAR from the workspace.
5) Import The EAR exported in step 3.
6) If you call EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule(), you'll now get an NPE:
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.componentcore.util.EJBArtifactEdit.getEJBClientJarModu le(EJBArtifactEdit.java:222) Created attachment 24892 This is the EAR I exported and then imported into my workspace Created attachment 24893 Plugin project containing a sample action which calls EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule() Neeraj - Can you confirm our behavior in previous releases?? Fixed, the problem was that the reference component for EJBClient in the EJB .wtpmodules was not being set. *** Bug 103862 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** closing
Bug.WithOutStack:
When I import an EAR which has an EJB module with an associated EJB client module, the relationship between the two doesn't appear to be preserved. To reproduce the problem you can do the following:
1) Create an EJB project named "TestEJBProject". Accept all the defaults and associate with an EAR called "TestEJBProjectEAR". By default, a client project called "TestEJBClientProject" will also be created.
2) If you get an EJBArtifactEdit for "TestEJBProject" and call its getEJBClientJarModule(), you will get the correct TestEJBClientProject IVirtualComponent.
3) Export TestEJBProjectEAR as an EAR file to the local filesystem.
4) Delete all TestEJBProject, TestEJBClientProject and TestEJBProjectEAR from the workspace.
5) Import The EAR exported in step 3.
6) If you call EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule(), you'll now get an NPE:
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.componentcore.util.EJBArtifactEdit.getEJBClientJarModu le(EJBArtifactEdit.java:222) Created attachment 24892 This is the EAR I exported and then imported into my workspace Created attachment 24893 Plugin project containing a sample action which calls EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule() Neeraj - Can you confirm our behavior in previous releases?? Fixed, the problem was that the reference component for EJBClient in the EJB .wtpmodules was not being set. *** Bug 103862 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** closing

Bug.Summery: [ui] "generate" should be "new"
Bug.WithStack:
Currently, if a DTD or XSD is selected in navigator, there is a menu choice for "generate" which always has just one item. "generate XML", I believe. (pehaps there's others? generate wsdl? generate jsp?).
It would be a better, less cluttered, and more consistent UI to simply include another item under the "new" menu action, so that if a DTD or XSD was selected, to allow "new file from dtd" or "new file from xsd" actions. These would do exactly the same thing as the current "generate" option, but would be a more consistent, less cluttered approach to "new" things. Craig, can you get someone to look at coordinating and architecting this "UI" issue? If not, please reassign to me and I'll see what can be done.
If you look at a similar paradigm in the Rational based tools (RAD 6.0), yes they have additional options like: HTML Doc, DTD, Java, DDL, etc. Though I agree with you that using a context-sensitive New option would be more natural.
There are some cases (this spans Eclipse subprojects) where these: new/generate/export/transform concepts are mixed. For example, to generate an Ecore/genmodel file from Rose, you need the "New" EMF wizard but to create the Ecore file from UML2 you do an Export.
Just one persons observations. David are you envisioning dynamic additions of shortcuts to the New... menu based on selection? Or are you just saying that if user added the New->XML shortcut to the New menu and clicks New->XML the wizard should be smart and offer defaults based on the selection (DTD, XSD)?
Gabriel, please clarify the requirement and work with the UI folks to get an oppinion. I am thinking it may be a bit late to change this for WTP 3.0 given all the documentation and downstream adopters implications. (In reply to comment #3) > David are you envisioning dynamic additions of shortcuts to the New... menu > based on selection? Or are you just saying that if user added the New->XML > shortcut to the New menu and clicks New->XML the wizard should be smart and > offer defaults based on the selection (DTD, XSD)? > > Gabriel, please clarify the requirement and work with the UI folks to get an > oppinion. I am thinking it may be a bit late to change this for WTP 3.0 given > all the documentation and downstream adopters implications. >
I guess both. It just seems wrong to have the "generate" context menu item, always with one choice (depending on what's selected) ... at least, I've only ever seen one choice.
And, to me, seems like a "create new" function, so, wondering why we needed a new category in context menu ... but, I'm not aware if any other 'new' items are context sensitive.
I would appreciate some investigation if UI experts feel this is an Eclipse consistency issue -- or UI Guidelines issue -- but, agree, its getting kind of late and is not an urgent priority.
As Steve suggests, perhaps this is also a "cross project" issue as well. How are "new database tables", "new reporting chart", etc. handled? There should be some consistency.

Bug.Summery: new EJB wizard should check if class name already exists
Bug.WithStack:
new EJB wizard does not check if the class name for the new EJB exists and allows creation of EJB. In that case only the last ejb created is build by xdoclet. Part of a mass update. Based on 9/22/2005 development review meeting, it's determined this was an open bug/enhancement with tartget mistakenly set to M8. Since this will not be in M8, I am changing to "unspecified".
If this is an error, please correct (for example the bug really has been fixed in M8, change back to M8, and "fixed".)

Bug.WithStack:

The PDE generates a build.xml that compiles the java code, and regarless the builders that are currently set for the plugin, the generated build.xml has no script to call the additional builders.

Bug.Summery: Allow to * export of packages to support development
Bug.WithStack:
Let say you are building a plugin on top of another library (lets call it SleepingBear) - the SleepingBear is undergoing some development, e.g. it refactors some internal classes into another new package.
Now the SleepingBear plugin does and should actually not care about this refactoring since its all about internal classes that it never directly uses, BUT that is of course not true since when the SleepingBear plugin tries to invoke methods in the SleepingBear which depends on these internal classes it will get ClassNotFoundExceptions and in some cases that is actually expected behavior inside the SleepingBear and thus it falls back to another behavior... and voila - it affects the behavior of the SleepingBear plugin.
This is something plugin developers can waste hours/days on tracking down until they by accident clicks "Add.." under exported packages and sees that a couple of new internal packages have been created...
I would really appreciate that the platform team once again considers adding back the notion of specifying that a plugin want to exports ALL current and future packages from a specific jar. Then when its time to rollout the plugindeveloper can restrict its package selection (this could be a warning that is shown when exporting a feature/site that contains such declarations)
thank you :) It is unclear from your description whether you are talking about one or two plug-ins. I guess it is the latter, because for a plug-in to access its own classes, you don't have to export anything. Im talking about the following:
sleepingBear.jar and its other related pure java .jars are bundled up and exported in org.sleepingbear.eclipse plugin
Another plugin depends on org.sleepingbear.eclipse
-max If you are writing a 2.1 style plug-in with the appropriate plugin.xml you will get the type of behavior you want. However this will not have great performance characteristics. To me the issue being reffered to here is mostly encountered at development time and I believe that the runtime should stay out of this type of business.
Also note that now PDE does a much better job of indicating things that should not be accessed.
Moving to PDE for resolution. * has no place in the manifest.mf
As of 3.2M5, PDE has introduced an Organize Manifests wizard which enumerates packages and adds them to the manifest.mf for you.
Also, refactoring/renaming packages now result in correct updating of the manifest.mf to reflect the changes. These additions are all nice, but does not solve the problem of where a user updates a thirdparty.jar which has a new package which by indirection is used - then it will start failing in very weird ways.
But I guess your answer will then just be to run eclipse in "non-safe" mode...where I would rather have the option of explicitly saying that this lib is simply just a 3rd party lib and whatever package it uses internally I should not be affected by.
(so reopening, just to verify that this what you want) I am not sure what you mean by "non-safe" mode, nor what this bug has to do with PDE in general anyway..
Moving bug back to Equinox to continue this discussion. By "non-safe" mode I mean the mode where the package dependencies are simply ignored at runtime. (Can't remember the correct name and if the mode actually still exists, making the package listings a pure build time/verification time issue) I'm having a hard time understanding the issues here. Do you have some example plugin projects that we can use to demonstrate the issues?
If packages are truely internal then the developer should never be forced to export the packages. Its been a while since I created the case - I'll try and create a dummy example.
But until then I'll be more specific about the most recent "accident" I had with this one:
In Hibernate Tools we use the hibernate library. This hibernate library is a jar + a set of other dependencies. I had added them all to my project and exported all the expected public packages. Anyhow everything where working fine and dandy until I updated the hibernate library to a newer release and suddenly weird things started to happening (applications behaved differently than before and sometimes weird ClassNotFound errors occurred).
I finally tracked it down to that in the updated hibernate library a new package had been added (org.hibernate.hql.ast.exec) and this package is completely internal and not ever used from the outside BUT the eclipse classloader prevented classes from this package to load and that is what I'm arguing against.
Why should the classloader prevent this ? The package does not need to be exported at all, but it results in ClassNotFoundException anyway.
Note, the issue only occur if <external plugin> invokes code in <org.hibernate.eclipse> plugin that exports a set of known-packages-at-buildtime for Hibernate.
In this situation the new package content cannot be loaded.
This can happen during development and if users upgrade the libraries which might well occur for 3rd party libs.
Was that better ? Thanks for taking the time to help us here. I think the best thing would be to get an example to work with.
Question: Is the internal package (in your latest example org.hibernate.hql.ast.exec) able to be loaded internally from the bundle which includes hibernate? Or are you talking about another bundle which depends on your bundle getting CNFEs? I saw the problem when
plugin X calls plugin Y which calls code in its bundled hibernate.jar that eventually would load org.hibernate.hql.ast.exec
I did not verify if it was happening if I only used plugin Y.
No fix is planned. It will break modular boundaries which is never a good thing. PDE has improved to flag packages which you do not export. I'm sorry - but the *current* situation breaks modularity since a plugin now has to know about internal package structuring details of its bundled jars.
Since I haven't tried verifying it on 3.3 I'll not reopen this issue now, but will try and create an example of what I mean is bad because it disallows updates for jars/plugins that has no change in their public API (they just changed/added an internal package)
So, in PDE land, we have a compiler preference called, Missing Exported Packages (Preferences->Plug-in Development->Compilers->Plug-ins). By default, this is set to IGNORE. Feel free to set this to ERROR in your project templates to ensure you're never missing an exported package.
Thank you for using PDE :)

Now the SleepingBear plugin does and should actually not care about this refactoring since its all about internal classes that it never directly uses, BUT that is of course not true since when the SleepingBear plugin tries to invoke methods in the SleepingBear which depends on these internal classes it will get ClassNotFoundExceptions and in some cases that is actually expected behavior inside the SleepingBear and thus it falls back to another behavior... and voila - it affects the behavior of the SleepingBear plugin.

Bug.Summery: Java Model Importer Exception
Bug.WithStack:
If someone does @model upperBound="*" in an attempt to do an unbounded list field the Annotated Java Importer will throw an exception:
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "*" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:447) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:497) at org.eclipse.emf.importer.java.builder.JavaEcoreBuilder.handleETypedElement (JavaEcoreBuilder.java:1248) ... etc ...
perhaps a more helpful warning should be in place (rather than launch eclipse in -debug mode) We've created a "Plan Item" so we can track what are the improvements we should make on the code generation error reporting and handling.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 104727 *** I'll reopen this bugzilla add a proper check and warning message for this. The fix is committed to CVS. Fixed in EMF 2.2.0RC4 (S200605151820). Move to verified as per bug 206558.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If someone does @model upperBound="*" in an attempt to do an unbounded list field the Annotated Java Importer will throw an exception:
... etc ...
perhaps a more helpful warning should be in place (rather than launch eclipse in -debug mode) We've created a "Plan Item" so we can track what are the improvements we should make on the code generation error reporting and handling.

Bug.Summery: JVEPROP03: Custom filter does not work
Bug.WithStack:
In executing JVEPROP03, I had a step where a custom filter was supposed to be used in order to allow for importing images. The example given by the test scenario was *.bmp and I tried to use it but did not get any BMP images in my selection list.
>> Verify that Filter: combobox works as expected. That when *.jpg is selected, only JPG files become available? And that youre able to input your own filter like *.bmp?
I tried *.bmp and never got any of my .BMPs to show in the selection list.
Eclipse 3.1 GEF 3.1 EMF-SDO 2.1 VE 1.1 I20050715 this could simply be an instance of a bad test case again. from sun:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/misc/icon.html
"Swing provides a particularly useful implementation of the Icon interface: ImageIcon (in the API reference documentation), which paints an icon from a GIF, JPEG, or (as of 1.3) PNG image."
*.bmp is not on this list and therefore it does not show up even if it matches the user defined filter. Jonathan's correct in that .bmp files are not supported. I corrected the script (SwingIconTestCase.htm) by removing this reference and updated several sentances that have question marks at the end (must be from the original script writer when doing a review).
Committed to HEAD for 1.1 closing for VE 1.1
Bug.WithOutStack:
In executing JVEPROP03, I had a step where a custom filter was supposed to be used in order to allow for importing images. The example given by the test scenario was *.bmp and I tried to use it but did not get any BMP images in my selection list.
>> Verify that Filter: combobox works as expected. That when *.jpg is selected, only JPG files become available? And that youre able to input your own filter like *.bmp?
I tried *.bmp and never got any of my .BMPs to show in the selection list.
Eclipse 3.1 GEF 3.1 EMF-SDO 2.1 VE 1.1 I20050715 this could simply be an instance of a bad test case again. from sun:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/misc/icon.html
"Swing provides a particularly useful implementation of the Icon interface: ImageIcon (in the API reference documentation), which paints an icon from a GIF, JPEG, or (as of 1.3) PNG image."
*.bmp is not on this list and therefore it does not show up even if it matches the user defined filter. Jonathan's correct in that .bmp files are not supported. I corrected the script (SwingIconTestCase.htm) by removing this reference and updated several sentances that have question marks at the end (must be from the original script writer when doing a review).
Committed to HEAD for 1.1 closing for VE 1.1

Bug.Summery: JVEPROP03: Instructions for adding Swing containers unclear
Bug.WithStack:
In executing JVEPROP03 I came across these instructions.
>> Drop the following Swing Containers on to a content pane and verify that an image can be added via the various image property and that visual class will save without errors.
I was using the visual class created earlier in the scenario. I noticed that adding a JFrame did not give me the usual dialog which prompts for the variable name to add to the visual class. The reason I mention this is because the scenario subsequently asks to look at the title bar for the icon to be changed and a title bar is only available on a top level window, not a child window. This same thing occurs for an AWT Frame which is also a top level container. Instructions for both of these should state to create a visual class which is derived from AWT Frame/Swing JFrame. JFrame / Frame cannot be inside content panel as far as I can tell.
The instructions state this: # Drop the following Swing Components on to a content pane. And verify that an image can be added via the icon property and that visual class will save without errors. And verify that the source has been updated with code to include the image upon the swing component:
* Jbutton * JcheckBox * JradioButton * JtoggleButton * Jlabel * JOptionPane
JFrame is not in this list.
The instructions then go on to state:
Drop the following Swing Containers on to the canvas and verify that an image can be added via the specific image property and that visual class will save without errors. And verify that the source has been updated with code to include the image upon the swing component:
o JFrame Drop a JFrame on to the canvas and select the iconImage button from the properties. This should insert the image into the title bar of the jframe.
o JInternalFrame Drop a JInternalFrame on to the canvas and select the frameIcon button . This should insert the image into the title bar.
Here it is not on the content pane, it is the white canvas.
Maybe the problem is the word "canvas" This means the white surface or what we call the freeform, which is distinct from "contentPane"
Bug.WithOutStack:
In executing JVEPROP03 I came across these instructions.
>> Drop the following Swing Containers on to a content pane and verify that an image can be added via the various image property and that visual class will save without errors.
I was using the visual class created earlier in the scenario. I noticed that adding a JFrame did not give me the usual dialog which prompts for the variable name to add to the visual class. The reason I mention this is because the scenario subsequently asks to look at the title bar for the icon to be changed and a title bar is only available on a top level window, not a child window. This same thing occurs for an AWT Frame which is also a top level container. Instructions for both of these should state to create a visual class which is derived from AWT Frame/Swing JFrame. JFrame / Frame cannot be inside content panel as far as I can tell.
The instructions state this: # Drop the following Swing Components on to a content pane. And verify that an image can be added via the icon property and that visual class will save without errors. And verify that the source has been updated with code to include the image upon the swing component:
* Jbutton * JcheckBox * JradioButton * JtoggleButton * Jlabel * JOptionPane

Bug.Summery: JVEPROP03: Adding JInternalFrame child window behaves improperly
Bug.WithStack:
In executing JVEPROP03 I came across these instructions.
>> Drop the following Swing Containers on to a content pane and verify that an image can be added via the various image property and that visual class will save without errors.
I was using the visual class created earlier in the scenario. I noticed that adding a JInternalFrame gave me 2 dialogs, one for the content panel and another for the internal frame. Code appeared to be inserted for the content panel and for the internal frame but I saw nothing in wither the visual editor or running the application.
Eclipse 3.1 GEF 3.1 EMF-SDO 2.1 VE 1.1 I20050715 Marco, The property to set is 'frameIcon' on the actual JInteralFrame, the content pane that is a child of the JInternalFrame. But the wording somewhat confusing for this and the JFrame in that it says to "Drop the following Swing Containers on to a content pane and verify that an image can be added via the various image property..."
For one thing you can't drop a JFrame onto a content pane, only onto the canvas.
Anyway, to clarify the instructions a bit (hopefully) I changed the script to read "Drop the following Swing Containers on to the canvas and verify that an image can be added via the specific image property and that visual class will save without errors." I also highlighted the specific properties to be set (in this case 'frameIcon' for JInteralFrame) so it will be clear on which property in the property sheet view to look for.
Could you please review it to see if it meets with your approval? Do you have any other suggestions for the wording? Here's the link--> http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/vep-home/WebContent/docs/testcases/swing-image-propeditor/SwingIconTestCase.htm
Thanks... Peter Walker
Marco, thanks for the review and suggestion. I updated the script fow dropping AWT controls (in this case a Frame) onto the canvas to make it more clear. VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.

Bug.Summery: [compiler] add primitives exception to "unnecessary cast" warnings
Bug.WithStack:
We'd like to have warnings about unnecessary Object casting, but also like to be a bit paranoid about our arithmatic expressions (we like excessive casting there). So it would be nice to have an arithmatic or primatives exception to the unnecessary cast warning option. Interesting suggestion. What about cast involving autoboxing ?
Integer i = (Integer) 12; Olivier - this would mean an extra option, #includePrimitiveCast or sthg like this. Would be enabled by default, for backward compatibility. It is worth mentioning that some casts from primitive types to object types are declared as unnecessary when they are in fact not unnecessary:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=418795
Bug.WithOutStack:
We'd like to have warnings about unnecessary Object casting, but also like to be a bit paranoid about our arithmatic expressions (we like excessive casting there). So it would be nice to have an arithmatic or primatives exception to the unnecessary cast warning option. Interesting suggestion. What about cast involving autoboxing ?
Integer i = (Integer) 12; Olivier - this would mean an extra option, #includePrimitiveCast or sthg like this. Would be enabled by default, for backward compatibility. It is worth mentioning that some casts from primitive types to object types are declared as unnecessary when they are in fact not unnecessary:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=418795

Bug.Summery: bogus "Missing end tag ..." squiggles when editing in source view
Bug.WithStack:
I've seen this a couple of times, here how to reproduce...
Import the 'wsdl' schema file below into your workspace and open it in the XML editor (or XML Schema editor) :
<wtp-install-location>\eclipse\plugins\org.wsdl4j_1.4.0\xsd\wsdl.xsd
In the source page, locate the following section :
<xs:complexType name="tDefinitions" > <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="wsdl:tExtensibleDocumented" > <xs:sequence> <xs:group ref="wsdl:anyTopLevelOptionalElement" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="targetNamespace" type="xs:anyURI" use="optional" /> <xs:attribute name="name" type="xs:NCName" use="optional" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
Now comment out some tags to produce this...
<xs:complexType name="tDefinitions" > <!-- <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="wsdl:tExtensibleDocumented" >--> <xs:sequence> <xs:group ref="wsdl:anyTopLevelOptionalElement" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="targetNamespace" type="xs:anyURI" use="optional" /> <xs:attribute name="name" type="xs:NCName" use="optional" /> <!-- </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent>--> </xs:complexType>
Notice that the <xs:complexType> element is squiggled even though the document is well formed. If we save and reopen the squiggles will be gone ... so seems like some state isn't getting updated properly as we edit. Mass transfer from pa to dw. Needs more triage.
This appears to be fixed now. I'll resolve as fixed. David any idea what change fixed this? This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version. If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Bug.Summery: External type Generic Server Configuration

Lines.Line: 1) The error message that was updated somehow got cut off at "...exter" (I
included a \n char in there so I don't know if this might have caused a problem
with the patch application logic)
2) Need to create a new Shell from the workbench display rather than using the
currently active shell as the dialog parent (I think it may be failing now due
to changing the "startBeforePublish" flag to true which results in the publish
dialog shell being the active shell when the error dialog is created).
dropped the latest patch
Hi Vaidya,

Bug.WithStack:
The Debug option does not work for external type generic server configuration.
I configured the JBoss 4.0 as a external type Generic server and started it in debug mode but cannot debug the applications deployed on that server and also the status of the server shows as "Started" not "Debugging".
I tried to debug the problem and found an interesting thing. When I stop the execution during debugging at beginning of the if statement in ExternalLaunchConfigurationDelegate the server did show the status as "Debugging" but does not start in debugging mode.
if (mode.equals("debug")) { ILaunchConfigurationWorkingCopy wc = createDebuggingConfig(configuration); // if we're launching the debugging we need to wait for the config to start // before launching the debugging session serverBehavior.setDebuggingConfig(wc, mode, launch, monitor); } Tim, for you. What I believe you're seeing is the following: if the remote Java debugging session is unable to attach to the specified debug port (note: you're server must start with debugging enabled and be listening on that port), then it will switch modes from debugging to running and thus display "Started"; you should see the associated connection error in the log file.
I need to make this debugging connection error more visible to the user. Created attachment 24982 Patch for *.generic.core
Opens an ErrorDialog when there is a problem launching the remote debugging session so that it's obvious to the user what happened. Fixed by the attached patch. Gorkem: if possible, would be great to get this in for RC2 dropped to HEAD Created attachment 25042 Updated patch
Two problems with the previous patch:
1) The error message that was updated somehow got cut off at "...exter" (I included a \n char in there so I don't know if this might have caused a problem with the patch application logic) 2) Need to create a new Shell from the workbench display rather than using the currently active shell as the dialog parent (I think it may be failing now due to changing the "startBeforePublish" flag to true which results in the publish dialog shell being the active shell when the error dialog is created). dropped the latest patch Hi Vaidya,
Wanted to check and see if you've been able to get debugging working w/ JBoss 4.0 as an external type generic server.
-Rob Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.

Bug.Summery: [1.5][compiler] incorrect 'unread field' diagnosis
NPE when 'Report problems as you type' is unchecked

Lines.Line: 1) uncheck 'Report problems as you type' in preferences
2) open an XML file in the XML Editor (or XML Schema editor)

Bug.WithStack:
As well as a pop up dialog (that doesn't say much) here's the stack I see in the error log. I was able to reproduce this with a variety of XML files. I think we need to have the option to turn this off in the case where the validator is performing slowly so users can disable background validation.
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.filterTotalScopeRegions(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:168) at org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.process(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:123) at org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.DirtyRegionProcessor.run(DirtyRegionProcessor.java:412) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76) Oops I should have mentioned the steps to reproduce more clearly...
1) uncheck 'Report problems as you type' in preferences 2) open an XML file in the XML Editor (or XML Schema editor)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 103867 *** Marking as verified just to signify correctly categorized.
Closing
Bug.WithOutStack:
As well as a pop up dialog (that doesn't say much) here's the stack I see in the error log. I was able to reproduce this with a variety of XML files. I think we need to have the option to turn this off in the case where the validator is performing slowly so users can disable background validation.
Oops I should have mentioned the steps to reproduce more clearly...
1) uncheck 'Report problems as you type' in preferences 2) open an XML file in the XML Editor (or XML Schema editor)

Bug.Summery: eclipse3.1 jdk5 NoSuchAlgorithmException
Update RCP Tutorial part 2 for 3.1
Bug.WithStack:
Split off from bug 104146 to just cover updating part 2 of the RCP tutorial currently athttp://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-2/tutorial2.html . I just wanted to point out that the link "Eclipse Rich Client Platform" in the References section of Parts 1, 2, and 3 opens up an extra navigation frame when clicked on. I tried clicking on the link with Firefox 1.0.6 and Internet Explorer 6. Ewwww, thanks for pointing that out. Created attachment 28978 Draft of the revised version.
I finally made myself sit down and work on this and came up with the first draft. Let me know if anything big is missing or wrong with it. Moving out of the articles inbox -- interested parties please cc yourself. I've pushed the revised article. Marking as fixed, but if there's a problem with it or any questions you can just add it here. Seems like there is something missing in the last sentence of the note below plugin.xml part:
"By convention only, package names and ids are lower case and class names"
Nothing critical :-)
I'm waiting for revised part 3 now, great articles anyway. Good eye, I've fixed the typo. It should have said "...and class names are MixedCase". Update for 3.1.2 A new version has been published of all three parts. John Franey wrote in email: 'I was reading your article tonight at eclipse.org and found a typo in the paragraph discussing case of ids, packages and classes in naming conventions. The sentence starts with: "By convention only, package names and ids are lower case and class names" but doesn't end.'
This has been fixed. It now reads "...class names are Pascal Case".
Why not CamelCase?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase
I never even knew that Pascal Case was a synonym for it until now :-) Actually that's why it got left blank in the first place, I got distracted looking up the difference between camel case and pascal case. Camel case can mean either ThisCapStyle or thisCapStyle (think 'humps'). Pascal case only means ThisCapStyle.

Split off from bug 104146 to just cover updating part 2 of the RCP tutorial currently athttp://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-2/tutorial2.html . I tried clicking on the link with Firefox 1.0.6 and Internet Explorer 6. Ewwww, thanks for pointing that out. Created attachment 28978 Draft of the revised version.

Nothing critical :-)

Update for 3.1.2 A new version has been published of all three parts. John Franey wrote in email: 'I was reading your article tonight at eclipse.org and found a typo in the paragraph discussing case of ids, packages and classes in naming conventions. The sentence starts with: "By convention only, package names and ids are lower case and class names" but doesn't end.'
This has been fixed. It now reads "...class names are Pascal Case".
Why not CamelCase?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase
I never even knew that Pascal Case was a synonym for it until now :-) Actually that's why it got left blank in the first place, I got distracted looking up the difference between camel case and pascal case. Bug.Summery: Blank pages will be generated when set Page Break to always/left/right.

Lines.Line: 1.Insert a label
2.Set Page Break After to always/left/right
3.Preview in pdf

Bug.WithStack:
Description: Blank pages will be generated when set Page Break to always/left/right.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Insert a label 2.Set Page Break After to always/left/right 3.Preview in pdf
Expected result: Only a page displays
Actual result: Blank pages show after the label page. These blank pages will disappear when set the Page Break After to auto. Test Build:20050718 The page-break-after has following values: auto Neither force nor forbid a page break before (after, inside) the generated box. always Always force a page break before (after) the generated box. left Force one or two page breaks before (after) the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page. right Force one or two page breaks before (after) the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.
This is the correct features.
Verify Build:20050721
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: Blank pages will be generated when set Page Break to always/left/right.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Insert a label 2.Set Page Break After to always/left/right 3.Preview in pdf
Expected result: Only a page displays
Actual result: Blank pages show after the label page. These blank pages will disappear when set the Page Break After to auto. Test Build:20050718 The page-break-after has following values: auto Neither force nor forbid a page break before (after, inside) the generated box. always Always force a page break before (after) the generated box. left Force one or two page breaks before (after) the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page. right Force one or two page breaks before (after) the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.
This is the correct features.
Verify Build:20050721

Bug.Summery: Unexpected whitespace will appear when edit text content.

Lines.Line: 1.Insert a text item and set content-type to Plain
2.Input " three spaces before" then press enter key

Bug.WithStack:
Description: Unexpected whitespace will appear when edit text content.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Insert a text item and set content-type to Plain 2.Input " three spaces before" then press enter key
Expected result: The second line will start from the begin.
Actual result: The second line's input cursor started from the forth place with three spaces before it.
Test Build:20050718 Auto indent is a common behavior for editors. verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: Unexpected whitespace will appear when edit text content.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Insert a text item and set content-type to Plain 2.Input " three spaces before" then press enter key
Expected result: The second line will start from the begin.
Actual result: The second line's input cursor started from the forth place with three spaces before it.
Test Build:20050718 Auto indent is a common behavior for editors. verified.

Bug.Summery: If I re-select csv file name, columns selected before in right pane disappeared.

Lines.Line: 1.Create a flatfile data source.
2.Create a related data set, select "table1.csv".
3.Select two columns from left pane to right.
4.Re-select "table1.csv" in dropdown list.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: If I re-select csv file name, columns selected before in right pane disappeared.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Create a flatfile data source. 2.Create a related data set, select "table1.csv". 3.Select two columns from left pane to right. 4.Re-select "table1.csv" in dropdown list.
Actual result: columns selected in right pane disappeared. It is fixed. Verified in build 20050720.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: If I re-select csv file name, columns selected before in right pane disappeared.
Steps to reproduce: 1.Create a flatfile data source. 2.Create a related data set, select "table1.csv". 3.Select two columns from left pane to right. 4.Re-select "table1.csv" in dropdown list.
Actual result: columns selected in right pane disappeared. It is fixed. Verified in build 20050720.

Bug.Summery: Select a flatfile data source then click on "next", "back", it doesn't focus on the flatfile data source agian.

Lines.Line: 1. When creating a flatfile data set, select a related data source.
2. Click on "next".It transfers to "Select columns" window.
3. Click on "back".

Bug.WithStack:
Description: Select a flatfile data source then click on "next", "back", it doesn't focus on the flatfile data source agian.
Steps to reproduce: 1. When creating a flatfile data set, select a related data source. 2. Click on "next".It transfers to "Select columns" window. 3. Click on "back".
Actual result: It focused on another data source, not the data source which was selected before. *** Bug 104179 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** It is fixed. Verified in build 20050720.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: Select a flatfile data source then click on "next", "back", it doesn't focus on the flatfile data source agian.
Steps to reproduce: 1. When creating a flatfile data set, select a related data source. 2. Click on "next".It transfers to "Select columns" window. 3. Click on "back".
Actual result: It focused on another data source, not the data source which was selected before. *** Bug 104179 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** It is fixed. Verified in build 20050720.

Bug.Summery: "Insert in layout" is not grayed out even if the data set is invalid.

Lines.Line: 1. Create an invalid data set in which there is no data.
2. Right click on this data set in data explorer view.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: "Insert in layout" is not grayed out even if the data set is invalid. This bug was ever resolved in previous version.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create an invalid data set in which there is no data. 2. Right click on this data set in data explorer view.
Actual result: in context menu, "insert in layout" is not grayed out. User can insert an invalid data set. After that, user can edit that data set to make it valid.
Verified in build 20050719.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: "Insert in layout" is not grayed out even if the data set is invalid. This bug was ever resolved in previous version.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create an invalid data set in which there is no data. 2. Right click on this data set in data explorer view.
Actual result: in context menu, "insert in layout" is not grayed out. User can insert an invalid data set. After that, user can edit that data set to make it valid.
Verified in build 20050719.

Bug.Summery: Spaces in parameter value which is entered are trimmed when previewed in html.

Lines.Line: 1. Create a ListBox parameter.
2. Import values.
3. Enter "a" and add to right pane.
4. Enter " a" and add to right pane.
5. Enter " a" and add to right pane.
6. Preview in html.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: Spaces in parameter value entered are trimmed when previewed in html.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a ListBox parameter. 2. Import values. 3. Enter "a" and add to right pane. 4. Enter " a" and add to right pane. 5. Enter " a" and add to right pane. 6. Preview in html.
Actual result: in drop down list of this parameter, they are all displayed as "a". 1) Drop down list is fine. 2) This issue is with default value returned from egnine. Use test case in this bug, set " a" as deafult value. The default value returned from engine becomes "" a"". Confirmed with submitter, this bug is about drop down list in parameter pane. Result of preview is correct. I notice that drop down list in parameter pane is not correct while drop down list in "Enter paramters" dialog is correct on this test case. BTW, According to SPEC, the value in selection list of scalar paramter is string instead of expression, so we needn't add double quotation marks on a constant string. if we set an item in selection list as default value, designer will add the quotation marks automatically, because default value is an expression. In eclipse parameter dialog pane, I see no problem in the list. Note my preview comments, There is a issue with default value returned from egnine. Use test case in this bug, set " a" as deafult value. The default value returned from engine becomes "" a"".
Please log a seperate bug if necessary. See attached file. Created attachment 25115 screen capture Created attachment 25116 design file See attached design file's list values. leading blanks are trimmed. I don't think this is a bug. Is this a expected behavior? Created attachment 25223 DesigneFile2 Created attachment 25224 NewDesignFile3 Created attachment 25225 NewDesignFile4 Please see attached zip file in NewDesignFile4. The leading blanks are there, but bugzilla upload file trim them.
Note:Please use zip file to attach design file or some one can find the other solution of bugzill.
(In reply to comment #11) > Please see attached zip file in NewDesignFile4. > The leading blanks are there, but bugzilla upload file trim them. > Note:Please use zip file to attach design file or some one can find the other > solution of bugzill.
I think the blanks are there but IE don't show them. Don't open deisng file with IE directly, please open them with other editor. This is a limitation of html option tag. See html content below:
<SELECT ID="新建参数_selection" CLASS="BirtViewer_Select" ONCHANGE="javascript:_comboBox_onChange('新建参数');"> <OPTION VALUE="a" LABEL="aaa"/>
<OPTION VALUE="a" SELECTED>"a"</OPTION>
<OPTION VALUE=" a">" a"</OPTION>
<OPTION VALUE="   a">"   a"</OPTION>
list values are ok. Space is encoded and perserved. If you choose one of them, the value will be passed over to engine properly. change the field This is a HTML limitation Verified in build 20050726.

Bug.Summery: Linux:No file listed for "*.*" filter when new a flat file data source

Lines.Line: 1. new a flat file data source and data set.
2. set filter to search "*.*" file as data source

Bug.WithStack:
decription: No file listed for "*.*" filter when new a flat file data source
steps to reproduce: 1. new a flat file data source and data set. 2. set filter to search "*.*" file as data source
actual result: No file listed for "*.*" filter when new a flat file data source
expected result: when set filter to be "*.*" to search file, all the files can be found The original file filter will attempt to construct a file based on the given name, directory and \ separator. In windows there is no problem but in linux the file separator is /. Use File.separator instead.
The original file filter will attempt to construct a file based on the given name, directory and \ separator. In windows there is no problem but in linux the file separator is /. Use File.separator instead.
verified in build 20050722
Bug.WithOutStack:
decription: No file listed for "*.*" filter when new a flat file data source
steps to reproduce: 1. new a flat file data source and data set. 2. set filter to search "*.*" file as data source
actual result: No file listed for "*.*" filter when new a flat file data source
expected result: when set filter to be "*.*" to search file, all the files can be found The original file filter will attempt to construct a file based on the given name, directory and \ separator. In windows there is no problem but in linux the file separator is /. Use File.separator instead.
The original file filter will attempt to construct a file based on the given name, directory and \ separator. In windows there is no problem but in linux the file separator is /. Use File.separator instead.
verified in build 20050722

Test Build:20050718 In the original version of SqlDataSetEditorPage, a schema filter will be load dynamically depending on the given db when the control is initialized. Once the db is shift from not supporting schema to supporting schema, the program will try to populate the schema combo box. The combo, however, has not yet been initialized because the in original initialization the construction of it is excluded.
Change the codes so that the schema combo would be instanced without regarding whether it is actually needed or not. If it is not necessary then simply disabled it in UI.
Verified Build:20050720
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: NullPointException is thrown when change data source in Edit Data Set builder.
Steps to reproduce: 1.New a dataset 2.In Edit Data Set builder, change data source from mysql to sybase, or change to data source based on datadirect driver. 3.Click Query to input query text
Expected result: No error.
Actual result:
Test Build:20050718 In the original version of SqlDataSetEditorPage, a schema filter will be load dynamically depending on the given db when the control is initialized. Once the db is shift from not supporting schema to supporting schema, the program will try to populate the schema combo box. The combo, however, has not yet been initialized because the in original initialization the construction of it is excluded.
Change the codes so that the schema combo would be instanced without regarding whether it is actually needed or not. If it is not necessary then simply disabled it in UI.
Verified Build:20050720

Bug.Summery: Timeout Exception when trying to debug any java program

Stacktrace.Reason: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 977.

Bug.WithStack:
I am unable to use debug. This is my java runtime: Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0-b64)
The following is the log when I try to debug a java program:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 5012 2005-07-18 11:16:25.410 !MESSAGE Exceptions occurred attempting to step over the frame !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5010 2005-07-18 11:16:25.410 !MESSAGE org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 977. occurred creating step request. !STACK 0 org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 977. at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply (PacketReceiveManager.java:174) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply (PacketReceiveManager.java:184) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:174) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:192) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.request.EventRequestImpl.enable (EventRequestImpl.java:223) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$StepHandler.createStepReque st(JDIThread.java:1757) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$StepHandler.step (JDIThread.java:1704) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.stepOver (JDIThread.java:1234) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIStackFrame.stepOver (JDIStackFrame.java:406) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.StepOverActionDelegate.stepAction (StepOverActionDelegate.java:30) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.StepActionDelegate.doAction (StepActionDelegate.java:25) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.AbstractDebugActionDelegate$DebugRequestJ ob.run(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:150) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76) This is likely a dup of bug 94452. Questions:
* what sort of hardware are you using? * when does the problem occurr (are you showing lots of variables/logical structures, etc)? * if you increase the communication timeout setting in the "Java > Debug" preferences, does the problem go away? (say from 3000ms to 5000ms).
As a workaround, you could try the replacement plug-in patch on bug 94452 (3rd attachment to the bug). Sorry for the delay in replying.
My hardware: P4 2.66GHz, 512MB RAM Problem occurs irrepective of whether I am showing a list of variables or not. I still get the exception even after increasing communication timeout setting. I unzipped the attachment from bug 94452 into eclipse directory after removing the old org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0 directory in plugin folder and started eclipse. The problem continues to occur even after that.
Please let me know if you need any further info.
(In reply to comment #1) > This is likely a dup of bug 94452. Questions: > * what sort of hardware are you using? > * when does the problem occurr (are you showing lots of variables/logical > structures, etc)? > * if you increase the communication timeout setting in the "Java > Debug" > preferences, does the problem go away? (say from 3000ms to 5000ms). > As a workaround, you could try the replacement plug-in patch on bug 94452 (3rd > attachment to the bug).
What VM/version are you using to debug your application? can you attach a sample program that causes the exception? (In reply to comment #3) > What VM/version are you using to debug your application? can you attach a > sample program that causes the exception?
I have an update on this...
I am building an application targeting WAS 3.5 and so am using the following java version: java version "1.2.2" Classic VM (J2RE 1.2.2 IBM build wn122-20000720 (JIT enabled: jitc))
When using this I am getting the problem.
When I move to the following version, everything is working: java version "1.5.0" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0-b64) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0-b64, mixed mode, sharing)
But, I need to debug with IBM java 1.2.2. How do I do that?
thanks.
VM versions 1.2.x do not have JDWP support required for debugging. You can copy jdwp.dll and jdwp_g.dll from the bin directory of a 1.3.1 VM to a 1.2.2 install and hope that debugging works. This worked for me using a Sun VM - not sure if it works with IBM VMs. Debugging on 1.2.x is not officially supported by Eclipse.
