Bug.Summery: The button in Dataset/Filters can not work
Bug.WithStack: In Eclipse3.1, there is a expression builder button in the DataSet/Filters. Click it, it does not work. This bug is related with expression builder dialog invocation, not specific to data set. Check if focus control is the button of cell editor. If it is, don't call super.focusLost( e ); It works.
Bug.WithOutStack: In Eclipse3.1, there is a expression builder button in the DataSet/Filters. Click it, it does not work. This bug is related with expression builder dialog invocation, not specific to data set. Check if focus control is the button of cell editor. If it is, don't call super.focusLost( e ); It works.

Bug.Summery: An additional column is generated when create a script data set

Lines.Line: 1. new a script data set with add two fields "a" as integer and "b" as string
2. then edit the script data set
3. "column1" is listed in output column tab
4. add another script data set. "column2" will listed in output columns tab

Bug.WithStack:
description: No additional column should be generated when create a script data set
steps to reproduce: 1. new a script data set with add two fields "a" as integer and "b" as string 2. then edit the script data set 3. "column1" is listed in output column tab 4. add another script data set. "column2" will listed in output columns tab
actual result: An additional column which named "column1" will be generated when create a script data set
expected result: No additional column will be generated when create a script data set It's caused by conflict of position in column hint. Position from model is staring with 0 in initialization, but from dte query is starting with 1. In global perspective, starting with 1 is wider used, and refreshPosition method will reset position starting with 1 to model after page activated. The solution is not to compare two positions any more. verified in build 20050722
Bug.WithOutStack:
description: No additional column should be generated when create a script data set
steps to reproduce: 1. new a script data set with add two fields "a" as integer and "b" as string 2. then edit the script data set 3. "column1" is listed in output column tab 4. add another script data set. "column2" will listed in output columns tab
actual result: An additional column which named "column1" will be generated when create a script data set
expected result: No additional column will be generated when create a script data set It's caused by conflict of position in column hint. Position from model is staring with 0 in initialization, but from dte query is starting with 1. In global perspective, starting with 1 is wider used, and refreshPosition method will reset position starting with 1 to model after page activated. The solution is not to compare two positions any more. verified in build 20050722

This is very interesting. For some reason the activitySupport extension point is null. This should never be the case. I see you have many plug-ins installed... are you also running a modified/patched Eclipse base by any chance? Pascal, do you have any insights here? Under what circumstances would an extension point we know to exist fail to be returned by IExtensionRegistry.getExtensionPoint(...) ? A casual trot through the code makes me think it might be a corrupt table file...
- are you also running a modified/patched Eclipse base by any chance?
No I am not. I have downloaded, unzip and started eclipse 3.1. No modifications. Mo patches. Just curious is blackdown a supported JRE? The reporter does not run the latest blackdown BTW. And the linux in question looks to me like it's a custom build. And he uses web tools 0.7 which requires GEF & draw2d 3.1 and not 3.01, EMF 2.1 and not EMF 2.0.2 or 2.0.1. Note also that the install is not straight because the EMF features seems to be missing too. Finally it also missing JEM to run WTP. http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/S-0.7RC1-200507150303/

This is very interesting. For some reason the activitySupport extension point is null. This should never be the case. I see you have many plug-ins installed... are you also running a modified/patched Eclipse base by any chance? Pascal, do you have any insights here? Under what circumstances would an extension point we know to exist fail to be returned by IExtensionRegistry.getExtensionPoint(...) ? A casual trot through the code makes me think it might be a corrupt table file...
- are you also running a modified/patched Eclipse base by any chance?
No I am not. I have downloaded, unzip and started eclipse 3.1. No modifications. Mo patches. Just curious is blackdown a supported JRE? The reporter does not run the latest blackdown BTW. And the linux in question looks to me like it's a custom build. And he uses web tools 0.7 which requires GEF & draw2d 3.1 and not 3.01, EMF 2.1 and not EMF 2.0.2 or 2.0.1. Note also that the install is not straight because the EMF features seems to be missing too. Finally it also missing JEM to run WTP. http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/S-0.7RC1-200507150303/
This makes for lot of potential problems. Just my 2 cents. It is true that I am not using the latest blackdown. I am working on a custom linux build - I am using Gentoo linux, with kernel 2.6.10. Part of the plugins are not the latest. Maybe this is the rezson for the error. But the problem is that I can not start a runtime workbench. And in the workbench I want to start the web tools are not included. Bug.Summery: Group on a computed column won't return any data.
Bug.WithStack:
description: Group on a computed column won't return any data.
steps to reproduce: group on a computed column,then preview
actual result: there are errors on the report page: There are errors in Table: null
Error0: data.engine.group.interval(1 time) detail:Set a numeric interval on a column with type org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataType$AnyType is not supported
expected result: Group on computed column doesn't resurn any data This feature can be suppored if computed column has data type information, which needs to be firstly implemented. Then it is considered as 2.0 feature. Support group on computed columns Add a data type column in computed column page, API has been changed.
verified in build 20050829

Bug.Summery: [ViewMgmt] Help view not pervasive

Lines.Line: - start with empty workspace
- close welcome view
- open debug perspective
- close help view in debug perspective
- close help view in Java perspective
-> help view only shows up in the current perspective
Help view is a sticky view.
This is related to bug 104191. I agree with the observation there that
opening/closing a sticky view (at least in this case) should always be done in
all perspectives, this would make the behaviour more intuitive.

- start with empty workspace - close welcome view - open debug perspective - F1 - close help view in debug perspective - close help view in Java perspective - F1 -> help view only shows up in the current perspective Help view is a sticky view. This has been fixed along the way. Closing.

Bug.Summery: [ViewMgmt] Help view does not close on all perspectives

Lines.Line: - start with empty workspace
- close welcome view
- open debug perspective
- close help view in debug perspective
-> help view still open in Java perspective
This is sticky view behaviour.

Bug.WithStack:
3.1
- start with empty workspace - close welcome view - open debug perspective - F1 - close help view in debug perspective -> help view still open in Java perspective This is sticky view behaviour.
Moving to platform UI to consider the change in sticky view behaviour whereby closing of the sticky view in one perspective will affect all the perspective.
Rational:
Sticky views feel like they are 'above' the perspective in that they shift the perspective content and persist when perspectives are switched. A mirroring behaviour with respect to closing the view would feel more consistent. I would like this, but it is dependant upon bug 57841. As it turns out, closing a view in a non-visible perspective is really quite tricky.
Nick, feel free to grab this one and the dependent bug if you feel up to a challenge. ;) Created attachment 26084 workspace error log from eclipse shutdown after help view problem occurs Comment on attachment 26084 workspace error log from eclipse shutdown after help view problem occurs
I'm not sure if this is the exact same problem, but sometimes when the prespective changes automatically to debug or team perspective, the help view pops up and wont close until eclipse does. Once this happens, I get exceptions when eclipse shuts down. Error log attached. This has been fixed along the way. Closing.

3. then set file filter to be "*.csv" again and choose the origal flat file

description:

expected result: If the columns selected from flat file can't be restored when select the file again, suggest to pop up an warning message that original status couldn't be restored A MessageDialog will now popup, asking user if he wants to select a different file filter with previous operations unsaved. Bug.Summery: Shared preference (per project basis) files contain platform specific line delimiters
Bug.WithStack:
First, thank you for the improvement #59258.
But the implementation has one critical (?) drawback: the files in <workspace>/<project>/.settings contains platform specific line delimiters.
I shared my settings via Subversion on Windows XP, if I change one setting on Mac OS, svn recognize changes in all lines. Thus, instead of having just one changed line, all lines changed.
OK, it is possible to share the settings, but a reliable configuration management is not possible. Why .settings is not handled as a text file? In this case, at least on CVS, the line delimiters are converted when getting the changes. Check the svn:eol-style property under Subversion. When set to native, this conversion should be transparent for the user. Ok to close? Sorry for any inconveniences and thanks for the hint.
See http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.1/ch07s02.html for further information on that topic.
Ready to "close bug"...
Bug.WithOutStack:
First, thank you for the improvement #59258.
But the implementation has one critical (?) drawback: the files in <workspace>/<project>/.settings contains platform specific line delimiters.
I shared my settings via Subversion on Windows XP, if I change one setting on Mac OS, svn recognize changes in all lines. Thus, instead of having just one changed line, all lines changed.
OK, it is possible to share the settings, but a reliable configuration management is not possible. Why .settings is not handled as a text file? In this case, at least on CVS, the line delimiters are converted when getting the changes. Check the svn:eol-style property under Subversion. When set to native, this conversion should be transparent for the user. Ok to close? Sorry for any inconveniences and thanks for the hint.
See http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.1/ch07s02.html for further information on that topic.
Ready to "close bug"...

Bug.Summery: [misc] "File has changed on FS" for class files in JAR after unzipping workspace

Lines.Line: - create new workspace
- binary-import org.junit
- exit
- zip workspace
- delete workspace
- unzip workspace
- start eclipse
- open-type TestCase
-> "The file has been changed on the filesystem. Do you want to load the
changes?" dialog; from now on this shows up everytime the class file editor opens

Bug.WithStack:
3.1
- create new workspace - binary-import org.junit - exit - zip workspace - delete workspace - unzip workspace - start eclipse - open-type TestCase -> "The file has been changed on the filesystem. Do you want to load the changes?" dialog; from now on this shows up everytime the class file editor opens
Filing against JDT/Text to start with, because the CU editor works fine. We handle this for text and Java source files but not for class files in JARs: we need to refresh the JAR itself.
Note that many other functions do not work if you simply unzip a workspace without refreshing it, e.g. search in text or source files is not possible until you refresh the corresponding file(s).
Bug.WithOutStack:
3.1
- create new workspace - binary-import org.junit - exit - zip workspace - delete workspace - unzip workspace - start eclipse - open-type TestCase -> "The file has been changed on the filesystem. Do you want to load the changes?" dialog; from now on this shows up everytime the class file editor opens
Filing against JDT/Text to start with, because the CU editor works fine. We handle this for text and Java source files but not for class files in JARs: we need to refresh the JAR itself.
Note that many other functions do not work if you simply unzip a workspace without refreshing it, e.g. search in text or source files is not possible until you refresh the corresponding file(s).

Bug.Summery: VE crashes on machines that require java2d to be switched off

Lines.Line: 1) Windows->Preferences->Java->Installed JRE's.
2) Select the jre that you are using, hit "Edit..."
3) Put your arg into the "Default VM Arguments" field.
1) We require one to do introspection for beaninfo.
2) We require one for the VE editor itself to run your editor session.
3) We have a spare sitting around so that when a new one is needed
it is quickly picked up.
closing

Bug.WithStack:
Hi,
We run all our jvms with the following flag
-Dsun.java2d.noddraw
There is no way to specify this flag to the jvms launched by VE. This causes VE to crash.
Please provide a way to specify this flag or use all the flags specified to Eclipse for the VE jvm
Further more - why does VE launch 3 additional jvms in the background ?
Cheers This is a show stopper for us. Please treat this bug as high priority. There is a way to specify it.
1) Windows->Preferences->Java->Installed JRE's. 2) Select the jre that you are using, hit "Edit..." 3) Put your arg into the "Default VM Arguments" field.
We have three jvms because:
1) We require one to do introspection for beaninfo. 2) We require one for the VE editor itself to run your editor session. 3) We have a spare sitting around so that when a new one is needed it is quickly picked up. closing
Bug.WithOutStack:
Hi,
We run all our jvms with the following flag
-Dsun.java2d.noddraw
There is no way to specify this flag to the jvms launched by VE. This causes VE to crash.
Please provide a way to specify this flag or use all the flags specified to Eclipse for the VE jvm
Further more - why does VE launch 3 additional jvms in the background ?
Cheers This is a show stopper for us. Please treat this bug as high priority. There is a way to specify it.
1) Windows->Preferences->Java->Installed JRE's. 2) Select the jre that you are using, hit "Edit..." 3) Put your arg into the "Default VM Arguments" field.
We have three jvms because:
1) We require one to do introspection for beaninfo. 2) We require one for the VE editor itself to run your editor session. 3) We have a spare sitting around so that when a new one is needed it is quickly picked up. closing

Bug.Summery: typing problem with import static, generics and enum
Printer friendly version of "Eclipse 3.1 - New and Noteworthy" contains more information than separated parts
Bug.WithStack:
The printer friendly version of "Eclipse 3.1 - New and Noteworthy" (http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news-all.html) contains more items than the parted announcement (eclipse-news-part1.html etc).
E.g. the item "Sharing Java project settings" appears in printer friendly version in section JDT, but not at eclipse-news-part2.html (the separated JDT section).
Is that intended? Reassigning to Platform Doc. Where do you see a printer-friendly version? The document linked above (eclipse-news-all.html) just contains three sections that are linked using tags within the same document (eclipse-news-all.html#part2 for JDT, etc). Since there is only one file it must be consistent. I am looking in the wrong place or has this been fixed? Go to http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/
Click on "New and Noteworthy" -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news.html
Click on "Printer friendly version covering all of Eclipse." -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news-all.html
On that printer-friendly version you'll find a section called "Sharing Java project settings".
Go back to "New and Noteworthy" -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news.html
Try to find the section "Sharing Java project settings" on the pages "Plarform", "JDT" and "PDE". I had no luck. When I did the R3.1 N&N, I put the content for each of the sections in separate files, and then hacked an ant task that would wrap enough html around the content to produce the two different variants. This meant that there was no way to get problems like the one identified in this bug, but required me to do all the html editing in plaintext (because the html tools always wanted to "fix" the fragments into complete pages).
Adding Dejan to the CC since this sounds like it's at least vaguely related to the "single UA content delivery" work he are doing. 3.1 what's new is now obsolete and has been deleted from HEAD
Bug.WithOutStack:
The printer friendly version of "Eclipse 3.1 - New and Noteworthy" (http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news-all.html) contains more items than the parted announcement (eclipse-news-part1.html etc).
E.g. the item "Sharing Java project settings" appears in printer friendly version in section JDT, but not at eclipse-news-part2.html (the separated JDT section).
Is that intended? Reassigning to Platform Doc. Where do you see a printer-friendly version? The document linked above (eclipse-news-all.html) just contains three sections that are linked using tags within the same document (eclipse-news-all.html#part2 for JDT, etc). Since there is only one file it must be consistent. I am looking in the wrong place or has this been fixed? Go to http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/
Click on "New and Noteworthy" -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news.html
Click on "Printer friendly version covering all of Eclipse." -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news-all.html
On that printer-friendly version you'll find a section called "Sharing Java project settings".
Go back to "New and Noteworthy" -> http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1-200506271435/eclipse-news.html
Try to find the section "Sharing Java project settings" on the pages "Plarform", "JDT" and "PDE". I had no luck. When I did the R3.1 N&N, I put the content for each of the sections in separate files, and then hacked an ant task that would wrap enough html around the content to produce the two different variants. This meant that there was no way to get problems like the one identified in this bug, but required me to do all the html editing in plaintext (because the html tools always wanted to "fix" the fragments into complete pages).
Adding Dejan to the CC since this sounds like it's at least vaguely related to the "single UA content delivery" work he are doing. 3.1 what's new is now obsolete and has been deleted from HEAD

Bug.Summery: Generate actions (and new files) need more options on charset
Bug.WithStack:
While fixing bug 103767, a conscious choice was made be remove "encodinginfo" from content models, be cause it did not seem to conceptually belong there, such information typically being the users preference, and only mattering when saved (or read). Craig explained part of the historical need for it which we'll have to put back in some day. For some Schema's or DTD's, if they are written with certain encodinggs, life shift-jis, and some tags or attributes do indeed use those characters, then a "generated" XML file might also include those characters, so to be able to generate it, and save it (without user intervention) the "best can do" is to assume the same charset as the orignal dtd or schema.
Craig and I discuss what I think is the idea way to do this (and still honor the usres preference in most cases, is to add a check box on generate dialog that gives the user the choice "use workbench prefernce, use same encoding as dtd, or use charset xyz (drop down list box). Amy, assigning to you for now for considertion for "consistent solution" accross all content types. mass reassignment of my bugs to xml-inbox Sounds more like an enhancement to me. Feel free to switch it back if it's not.
